title: (x) "The End" movie script - various alternatives {gang}
content:
I'm certain this is done by hand, but does anyone have a suggest for something similar? It's the end title card from Hitchcock's Notorious.  
Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130905122305im_/http:/typophile.com/files/the_end_4766.gif)
author: kiarostami

comments.content:
[Dorchester Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20130905122305/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=M.126005.0.2&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=The+End+&sampleSize=96)  
 [Ballantines Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20130905122305/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=EF.122758.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=The+End+&sampleSize=48)

[Incognito](http://web.archive.org/web/20130905122305/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=10&displayfontid=FT.123355.0.0&fontRendererText=The+End+) has similar swash caps, but is more of a serif than script.

You might like [Zanzibar](http://web.archive.org/web/20130905122305/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FT.118699.0.0) even though it's not as tame.

I think you're looking for something more 1930s showcard rather than a formal script - The font you're really looking for that most closely resembles your request is actually [Metroscript](http://web.archive.org/web/20130905122305/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?preadd=action&key=ALSO-MESR) by Michael Doret.

Stuart :D
Wow! That is a beautiful font. Thanks for the responses.

[Harold Lohner's](http://web.archive.org/web/20130905122305/http:/www.haroldsfonts.com/) [Roselyn](http://web.archive.org/web/20130905122305/http:/www.haroldsfonts.com/roselyn.html) is similar if skewed a bit.
